title: SQL-Driven Analysis of Historical MLB Data
text:
The Lahman Baseball Dataset is a famous dataset when learning relational datasets.


Show the code
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import plotly.express as px
import sqlite3

sqlite_file = '../Data/lahmansbaseballdb.sqlite'
con = sqlite3.connect(sqlite_file)




Show the code
query = """
SELECT s.yearID
,      s.playerID
,      p.nameFirst || ' ' || p.nameLast AS name
,      s.salary
,      b.HR
,      b.RBI
,      b.AB
,      b.H
,      f.PO
,      f.A
,      f.E
,      f.G AS fielding_G,pi.W
,      pi.SO
,      pi.ERA
,      pi.G AS pitching_G

FROM Salaries s
LEFT JOIN Batting b ON s.playerID = b.playerID AND s.yearID = b.yearID
LEFT JOIN Fielding f ON s.playerID = f.playerID AND s.yearID = f.yearID
LEFT JOIN Pitching pi ON s.playerID = pi.playerID AND s.yearID = pi.yearID
JOIN People p ON s.playerID = p.playerID

WHERE s.salary IS NOT NULL
"""
df = pd.read_sql(query, con)

title: About
text:
I’m Kade Nef, a senior at Brigham Young University–Idaho, originally from Idaho Falls, Idaho. When I’m not in class, you’ll find me hiking local trails, playing disc golf, or enjoying time with my family.
Below is a curated selection of my projects. Each demonstrates my abilities in:

Data Wrangling
Leveraging tools like pandas (Python) and the tidyverse (R) to clean, transform, and prepare data for analysis.

Data Visualization
Crafting clear, engaging visuals with ggplot2, seaborn, Plotly, and more.

SQL Querying
Writing optimized queries to extract insights from relational databases.

Machine Learning
Building, tuning, and evaluating predictive models to solve real-world problems.

Thank you for taking the time to explore my work.
